repo_info.name: openrag
repo_info.description: OpenRAG is a comprehensive, single package Retrieval-Augmented Generation platform built on Langflow, Docling, and Opensearch.

readme:
# OpenRAG
        
OpenRAG is a comprehensive Retrieval-Augmented Generation platform that enables intelligent document search and AI-powered conversations. Users can upload, process, and query documents through a chat interface backed by large language models and semantic search capabilities. The system utilizes Langflow for document ingestion, retrieval workflows, and intelligent nudges, providing a seamless RAG experience. Built with [Starlette](https://github.com/Kludex/starlette) and [Next.js](https://github.com/vercel/next.js). Powered by [OpenSearch](https://github.com/opensearch-project/OpenSearch), [Langflow](https://github.com/langflow-ai/langflow), and [Docling](https://github.com/docling-project/docling).
Quickstart   |   Python package   |   Docker or Podman   |   Development   |   Troubleshooting
## Quickstart To run OpenRAG without creating or modifying any project files, use `uvx`: ```bash uvx openrag ``` This command runs OpenRAG without installing it to your project or globally. To run a specific version of OpenRAG, run `uvx --from openrag==VERSION openrag`. ## Install Python package To add the OpenRAG Python package to a Python project, use `uv`: 1. Create a new project with a virtual environment using `uv init`: ```bash uv init YOUR_PROJECT_NAME cd YOUR_PROJECT_NAME ``` The `(venv)` prompt doesn't change, but `uv` commands will automatically use the project's virtual environment. For more information on virtual environments, see the [uv documentation](https://docs.astral.sh/uv/pip/environments). 2. Add OpenRAG to your project: ```bash uv add openrag ``` To add a specific version of OpenRAG, run `uv add openrag==VERSION`. 3. Start the OpenRAG terminal user interface (TUI): ```bash uv run openrag ``` 4. Continue with the [Quickstart](https://docs.openr.ag/quickstart). For all installation options, see the [OpenRAG installation guide](https://docs.openr.ag/install). ## Docker or Podman installation By default, OpenRAG automatically starts the required containers and helps you manage them. To install OpenRAG with self-managed containers, see the [OpenRAG installation guide](https://docs.openr.ag/docker). ## Development For developers wanting to contribute to OpenRAG or set up a development environment, see [CONTRIBUTING.md](CONTRIBUTING.md). ## Troubleshooting For common issues and fixes, see [Troubleshoot OpenRAG](https://docs.openr.ag/support/troubleshoot).

issues.title: Docs: Unify the terminology used to describe OpenSearch
issues.body:
OpenSearch is variously described as a vector database, database, knowledge base, storage, instance, and so on. 
We should unify on the appropriate terms to use and when.

The [introduction](https://docs.openr.ag/) and all other [summaries of OpenSearch](https://docs.openr.ag/knowledge) should include all the functionality that OpenRAG uses, not just vector search.

Docs: Search functionality
issues.body:
We need to figure out how to enable search for the OpenRAG docs, either by extending Algolia coverage from Langflow or creating a new Algolia plan for OpenRAG.

If it's not possible to enable search in a reasonable amount of time, the pages need to be broken down granularly (one main idea per page). Typically, we group a few related ideas on one page (ex. _Manage widgets_ would cover all CRUD operations for widgets). This only works well when search is available so users can find niche subjects

issues.title: Docs: Install page complexity
issues.body:
The Install pages are crowded, and the page titles are misleading because all options use Docker/Podman.

This content needs to be restructured to make it easier to follow and separate the nonessential information from the core install and setup.

```
Install
   Choose an installation method
   Run the install script
   Install with uv
   Invoke with uvx
   Install on Windows
   Install self-managed containers
   Upgrade
   Reinstall
   Uninstall
Use the TUI
Manage containers
```

issues.title: Add all model provider variables to .env.example
issues.body:
Currently, [.env.example](https://github.com/langflow-ai/openrag/blob/main/.env.example) has only `OPENAI_API_KEY`. It would be helpful to put all possible model provider variables there, like we have done for OAuth.

- `OPENAI_API_KEY`
- `ANTHROPIC_API_KEY`
- `OLLAMA_ENDPOINT`
- `WATSONX_API_KEY`
- `WATSONX_ENDPOINT`
- `WATSONX_PROJECT_ID`

issues.title: TUI: Docker pulls wrong image version when starting for the first time after an update
issues.body: When starting the TUI for the first time, it sets OPENRAG_VERSION correctly with the TUI version, but doesn't refresh the environment, so the docker commands called still have the old version, so the old version is pulled.

Nit: Flow names are inconsistent in flow json
issues.body:
Nitpick: The flow `name` values are inconsistent in the [flow JSON files](https://github.com/langflow-ai/openrag/blob/main/flows/ingestion_flow.json#L4288). Two have `Flow` in the `name` and two don't:

- `"name": "OpenRAG OpenSearch Nudges"`
- `"name": "OpenRAG OpenSearch Agent"`
- `"name": "OpenSearch Ingestion Flow"`
- `"name": "OpenSearch URL Ingestion Flow"`
